description.zh-cn: 明朝第二位皇帝，明太祖朱元璋之孙，懿文太子朱标之子。在位期间进行建文改制，因削藩政策引发靖难之变，后在燕王朱棣攻入南京后下落不明。
description.en: The second emperor of the Ming dynasty, grandson of the Hongwu Emperor (Zhu Yuanzhang) and son of Crown Prince Zhu Biao. During his reign, he implemented the Jianwen Reforms. His policy of reducing the power of feudatory princes led to the Jingnan campaign, after which he disappeared when the Prince of Yan, Zhu Di, captured Nanjing.

description.zh-cn: 明朝第三位皇帝，明太祖朱元璋第四子，建文帝朱允炆的叔叔。发动靖难之变夺取皇位。
description.en: The third emperor of the Ming dynasty, the fourth son of the Hongwu Emperor (Zhu Yuanzhang) and the uncle of the Jianwen Emperor (Zhu Yunwen). He seized the throne by launching the Jingnan campaign.

description.zh-cn: 因建文帝削藩，燕王朱棣起兵反叛，最终攻入南京夺取皇位的战争。
description.en: A war initiated by Zhu Di, the Prince of Yan, in rebellion against the Jianwen Emperor's policy of reducing the power of feudatory princes, which ultimately resulted in Zhu Di's capture of Nanjing and seizure of the throne.

description.zh-cn: 明朝开国皇帝，建文帝朱允炆的祖父。
description.en: The founding emperor of the Ming dynasty and the grandfather of the Jianwen Emperor, Zhu Yunwen.

description.zh-cn: 明太祖朱元璋的长子，建文帝朱允炆的父亲，被追尊为兴宗孝康皇帝。
description.en: The eldest son of the Hongwu Emperor (Zhu Yuanzhang) and the father of the Jianwen Emperor (Zhu Yunwen), posthumously honored as Emperor Xingzong Xiaokang.

description.zh-cn: 明兴宗朱标的次妃，建文帝朱允炆的生母。
description.en: The secondary consort of Zhu Biao (Emperor Xingzong) and the birth mother of the Jianwen Emperor (Zhu Yunwen).

description.zh-cn: 建文帝朱允炆的皇后，在燕军攻入南京时自焚而死。
description.en: The empress of the Jianwen Emperor (Zhu Yunwen), who died by self-immolation when the Prince of Yan's army captured Nanjing.

description.zh-cn: 建文帝朱允炆的长子，被立为皇太子，在靖难之变后下落不明。
description.en: The eldest son of the Jianwen Emperor (Zhu Yunwen), who was installed as Crown Prince and disappeared after the Jingnan campaign.

description.zh-cn: 建文帝朱允炆的次子，靖难之变后被明成祖长期囚禁。
description.en: The second son of the Jianwen Emperor (Zhu Yunwen), who was imprisoned for a long period by the Yongle Emperor after the Jingnan campaign.

description.zh-cn: 明朝初年的首都，即今江苏省南京市。
description.en: The capital of the early Ming dynasty, modern-day Nanjing, Jiangsu Province.

description.zh-cn: 建文帝在位期间进行的一系列旨在实行宽政、减轻赋税和削弱藩王权力的改革。
description.en: A series of reforms implemented during the Jianwen Emperor's reign aimed at establishing lenient governance, reducing taxes, and curbing the power of feudatory princes.

description.zh-cn: 建文帝时期的兵部尚书，靖难之役后被明成祖所杀。
description.en: Minister of War during the Jianwen Emperor's reign, executed by the Yongle Emperor after the Jingnan campaign.

description.zh-cn: 建文帝时期的太常寺卿，主张削藩，靖难之役后被明成祖所杀。
description.en: Minister of the Court of Imperial Sacrifices during the Jianwen Emperor's reign. He advocated for reducing the power of feudatory princes and was executed by the Yongle Emperor after the Jingnan campaign.

description.zh-cn: 建文帝时期的翰林院侍讲，靖难之役后因不屈于朱棣而被灭十族。
description.en: An expositor-in-waiting of the Hanlin Academy during the Jianwen Emperor's reign. After the Jingnan campaign, he was executed along with his ten degrees of kinship for defying Zhu Di.

description.zh-cn: 周王，明太祖第五子，被建文帝废为庶人。
description.en: Prince of Zhou, the fifth son of the Hongwu Emperor, who was deposed to a commoner by the Jianwen Emperor.

description.zh-cn: 湘王，明太祖第十二子，在建文帝削藩时自焚而死。
description.en: Prince of Xiang, the twelfth son of the Hongwu Emperor, who died by self-immolation during the Jianwen Emperor's campaign to reduce the power of feudatory princes.

description.zh-cn: 齐王，明太祖第七子，被建文帝废为庶人。
description.en: Prince of Qi, the seventh son of the Hongwu Emperor, who was deposed to a commoner by the Jianwen Emperor.

description.zh-cn: 代王，明太祖第十三子，被建文帝废为庶人。
description.en: Prince of Dai, the thirteenth son of the Hongwu Emperor, who was deposed to a commoner by the Jianwen Emperor.

description.zh-cn: 岷王，明太祖第十八子，被建文帝废为庶人。
description.en: Prince of Min, the eighteenth son of the Hongwu Emperor, who was deposed to a commoner by the Jianwen Emperor.

description.zh-cn: 明朝将领，在靖难之役中率领中央军对抗燕军，后投降朱棣。
description.en: A Ming dynasty general who led the imperial army against the Prince of Yan during the Jingnan campaign but later surrendered to Zhu Di.

description.zh-cn: 谷王，明太祖第十九子，在靖难之役中与李景隆一同开金川门投降燕军。
description.en: Prince of Gu, the nineteenth son of the Hongwu Emperor, who, along with Li Jinglong, opened the Jinchuan Gate to surrender to the Prince of Yan's army during the Jingnan campaign.

description.zh-cn: 建文帝时期官员，在靖难之役中坚守济南，后被朱棣处死。
description.en: An official during the Jianwen Emperor's reign who famously defended Jinan during the Jingnan campaign and was later executed by Zhu Di.

description.zh-cn: 建文帝时期将领，在靖难之役中取得东昌大捷，后兵败。
description.en: A general during the Jianwen Emperor's reign who achieved a major victory at Dongchang during the Jingnan campaign but was later defeated.

description.zh-cn: 南明第一位皇帝，为建文帝上庙号和谥号。
description.en: The first emperor of the Southern Ming dynasty, who granted a temple name and posthumous title to the Jianwen Emperor.

description.zh-cn: 清朝皇帝，追谥建文帝为“恭闵惠皇帝”。
description.en: An emperor of the Qing dynasty who granted the posthumous title 'Gongmin Hui Huangdi' to the Jianwen Emperor.

description.zh-cn: 明朝驸马都尉，受明太祖临终托付辅佐建文帝。
description.en: A Commandant-escort of the Ming dynasty, entrusted by the Hongwu Emperor on his deathbed to assist the Jianwen Emperor.

description.zh-cn: 懿文太子朱标之子，建文帝朱允炆之弟。靖难之变后被朱棣废为庶人并囚禁。
description.en: Son of Crown Prince Zhu Biao and younger brother of the Jianwen Emperor (Zhu Yunwen). After the Jingnan campaign, he was deposed to a commoner and imprisoned by Zhu Di.

description.zh-cn: 在懿文太子朱标去世后，朱元璋跳过其他孙子，立朱允炆为皇太孙。
description.en: After the death of Crown Prince Zhu Biao, Zhu Yuanzhang bypassed other grandsons and installed Zhu Yunwen as the Crown Grandson.

description.zh-cn: 在位期间进行一系列宽政、削藩的改革。
description.en: During his reign, he implemented a series of reforms focused on lenient governance and reducing the power of feudatory princes.

description.zh-cn: 以“有罪”为由，将周王朱橚废为庶人，并迁徙至云南。
description.en: Deposed Zhu Su, the Prince of Zhou, to commoner status and exiled him to Yunnan on grounds of being 'guilty of crimes'.

description.zh-cn: 因削藩政策，湘王朱柏被迫自焚而死。
description.en: Due to the policy of reducing feudatory power, Zhu Bo, the Prince of Xiang, was forced to commit self-immolation.

description.zh-cn: 以“有罪”为由，将齐王朱榑废为庶人。
description.en: Deposed Zhu Fu, the Prince of Qi, to commoner status on grounds of being 'guilty of crimes'.

description.zh-cn: 以“有罪”为由，将代王朱桂废为庶人。
description.en: Deposed Zhu Gui, the Prince of Dai, to commoner status on grounds of being 'guilty of crimes'.

description.zh-cn: 以“有罪”为由，将岷王朱楩废为庶人，并迁徙至漳州。
description.en: Deposed Zhu Pian, the Prince of Min, to commoner status and exiled him to Zhangzhou on grounds of being 'guilty of crimes'.

description.zh-cn: 以“靖难”为名，在封地北平起兵反叛建文帝。
description.en: Under the pretext of 'quelling the turmoil' (Jingnan), he launched a rebellion against the Jianwen Emperor from his fiefdom in Beiping.

description.zh-cn: 燕军攻入京师，建文帝在宫中举火后下落不明，皇位被夺。
description.en: The Prince of Yan's army captured the capital, and the Jianwen Emperor disappeared after a fire in the palace, losing the throne.

description.zh-cn: 朱棣发动靖难之变，与侄子建文帝争夺皇位并最终成功。
description.en: Zhu Di launched the Jingnan campaign to contest the throne with his nephew, the Jianwen Emperor, and was ultimately successful.

description.zh-cn: 在燕军兵临城下时，打开金川门投降，导致南京陷落。
description.en: When the Prince of Yan's army besieged the capital, he opened the Jinchuan Gate to surrender, leading to the fall of Nanjing.

description.zh-cn: 与李景隆一同打开金川门，放燕军入城，背叛了建文帝。
description.en: Along with Li Jinglong, he opened the Jinchuan Gate to allow the Prince of Yan's army into the city, betraying the Jianwen Emperor.

description.zh-cn: 在靖难之役中坚守济南，多次击退燕军进攻，使朱棣无法攻克。
description.en: During the Jingnan campaign, he steadfastly defended Jinan and repelled multiple attacks from the Prince of Yan's army, preventing its capture.

description.zh-cn: 在东昌之战中大败燕军，并斩杀燕军大将张玉。
description.en: He decisively defeated the Prince of Yan's army at the Battle of Dongchang and killed its leading general, Zhang Yu.

description.zh-cn: 靖难之变后，将年仅2岁的朱文圭废为庶人并长期囚禁于凤阳。
description.en: After the Jingnan campaign, he deposed the two-year-old Zhu Wengui to commoner status and imprisoned him in Fengyang for a long period.

description.zh-cn: 以“不能匡正建文帝”为由将朱允熥废为庶人，并囚禁于凤阳。
description.en: Deposed Zhu Yuntong to commoner status and imprisoned him in Fengyang on the grounds that he 'failed to correct the Jianwen Emperor'.

description.zh-cn: 建文帝即位后，晋用齐泰为兵部尚书，同参军国事，倚为心腹。
description.en: After ascending the throne, the Jianwen Emperor promoted Qi Tai to Minister of War and relied on him as a key advisor in military affairs.

position.en: Minister of the Court of Imperial Sacrifices

description.zh-cn: 建文帝即位后，晋用黄子澄为太常寺卿，同参军国事，倚为心腹。
description.en: After ascending the throne, the Jianwen Emperor promoted Huang Zicheng to Minister of the Court of Imperial Sacrifices and relied on him as a key advisor in state affairs.

description.zh-cn: 建文帝即位后，召方孝孺为翰林院侍讲，倚为心腹。
description.en: After ascending the throne, the Jianwen Emperor summoned Fang Xiaoru to serve as an Expositor-in-waiting of the Hanlin Academy and relied on him as a key advisor.

description.zh-cn: 为建文帝君臣平反，上庙号“惠宗”，谥号“让皇帝”。
description.en: Rehabilitated the Jianwen Emperor and his officials, granting him the temple name 'Huizong' and the posthumous title 'Rang Huangdi'.

description.zh-cn: 追谥建文帝为“恭闵惠皇帝”。
description.en: Posthumously honored the Jianwen Emperor with the title 'Gongmin Hui Huangdi'.

description.zh-cn: 在建文帝失踪后，私下为其发丧，上谥号“孝愍皇帝”，庙号“神宗”。
description.en: After the Jianwen Emperor's disappearance, he privately held a funeral for him and conferred the posthumous title 'Xiaomin Huangdi' and the temple name 'Shenzong'.
